item.title: AirAsia has relocated its Surabaya operations to the new Terminal 2 at Juanda
item.description:
AirAsia has relocated its operations from Terminal 1 to the new Terminal 2 at Juanda International Airport. All AirAsia domestic and international flights to and from Surabaya will keep their original schedules and operate as usual. Terminal 2 at Juanda International Airport opened on February 14th. The terminal is designed to be environmentally friendly and can accommodate 6 million passengers annually. It features 40 check-in counters, an updated baggage handling system, six gates for domestic use, three gates for international flights, 12 avirobridges, and 14 parking stands for both narrow and wide-bodied aircraft...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/airasia-has-relocated-its-surabaya-operations-to-the-new-terminal-2-at-juanda/
